messages.subject: Nail Salon
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Collette, As far as working it a Nail Salon, while pregnant.  I m certainly glad I didn t have to do it.  I would expect that it would effect an unborn
messages.messageBody:
Hi Collette,

As far as working it a Nail Salon, while pregnant. I'm certainly glad I
didn't have to do it. I would expect that it would effect an unborn
child, how I have no idea. I have friends who might know. From the
information I have, anything with formaldehyde in is a possible human
carcinogen. Many cosmetics contain formaldehyde as a preservative. The
information is from a Toxin Checklist that can be ordered from Healthy
Home Publishing toll-free 1-(877) 288-3344. It's a informative list
that takes the ten most common cleaners and personal care products and
lists the long and short term hazards.

Sherry

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Nail Salon
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, Sherry. I definitely use that number. I do know that nail polish usually contains dibutyl phtalate that gets into a woman s reproductive organs and
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, Sherry. I definitely use that number. I do know that nail polish usually contains dibutyl phtalate that gets into a woman's reproductive organs and when she becomes pregnant gets into the babies also causing defects.  I wonder if this is why so many woman have trouble conceiving...probably a combination of environmental chemicals and the chemicals ingested from processed and conventionally grown food.-Collette
----- Original Message -----
From: Sherry Hagen
To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
Sent: Monday, April 02, 2001 11:53 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Nail Salon

Hi Collette,

As far as working it a Nail Salon, while pregnant.  I'm certainly glad I
didn't have to do it.  I would expect that it would effect an unborn
child, how I have no idea.  I have friends who might know.  From the
information I have, anything with formaldehyde in is a possible human
carcinogen.  Many cosmetics contain formaldehyde as a preservative.  The
information is from a Toxin Checklist that can be ordered from Healthy
Home Publishing toll-free 1-(877) 288-3344.  It's a informative list
that takes the ten most common cleaners and personal care products and
lists the long and short term hazards.

Sherry
